approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

boostYield(address,uint256).custom:emits: YieldBoosted event with user and amount details
boostYield(address,uint256).custom:requirements: - amount must be greater than zero   - Caller must have MANAGER_ROLE   - Contract must not be paused   - Caller must have approved this contract to spend the tokens
boostYield(address,uint256).custom:state-changes: - Increases totalBase by the specified amount   - Increases totalAccruedInterest by the specified amount   - Transfers tokens from caller to this contract
boostYield(address,uint256).details: Increases the vault's total assets and accrued interest, which benefits      all shareholders by increasing the value of their shares. This function      is typically called when liquidations generate profit for the protocol.

params.amount: Amount of base asset to add to the vault's yield
params.user: Address of the user whose position generated the yield boost

borrow(uint256,address).custom:error-cases: - LowLiquidity: When insufficient funds available for borrowing
borrow(uint256,address).custom:requirements: - Caller must have PROTOCOL_ROLE (typically LendefiCore)   - Contract must not be paused   - Sufficient liquidity must be available (totalBorrow + amount <= totalSuppliedLiquidity)
borrow(uint256,address).custom:state-changes: - Increases totalBorrow by the borrowed amount   - Increases borrowerDebt[receiver] to track individual debt   - Transfers borrowed assets to the receiver
borrow(uint256,address).details: This function is exclusively used by the LendefiCore contract to      facilitate lending operations. It manages the vault's available      liquidity and tracks individual borrower debt positions.

params.amount: Amount of base asset to borrow from the vault
params.receiver: Address that will receive the borrowed assets

checkUpkeep(bytes).custom:gas-efficient: View function with minimal gas consumption for frequent calls
checkUpkeep(bytes).custom:interval: Uses the contract's interval variable to determine timing
checkUpkeep(bytes).details: This view function is called by Chainlink Automation infrastructure to      determine whether performUpkeep should be executed. The upkeep is needed      when sufficient time has elapsed since the last Proof of Reserves update.

returns.performData: Encoded data to pass to performUpkeep (returns empty bytes)
returns.upkeepNeeded: Boolean indicating whether performUpkeep should be called

claimReward().custom:access-control: Available to any eligible caller when not paused
claimReward().custom:emits: Reward event with the caller's address and reward amount
claimReward().custom:requirements: - Caller must be eligible for rewards (checked by isRewardable)   - Contract must not be paused   - Sufficient time must have passed since last reward claim   - Caller must have provided minimum required liquidity
claimReward().custom:rewards: Reward amount is capped by maxReward from ecosystem contract
claimReward().custom:state-changes: - Resets liquidityOperationBlock[msg.sender] to current block   - Triggers reward distribution through ecosystem contract
claimReward().details: Calculates and distributes time-based rewards to users who have provided      liquidity for a sufficient duration and amount. The reward system incentivizes      long-term liquidity provision and protocol participation.      Reward eligibility is based on:      - Time since last liquidity operation (must exceed rewardInterval)      - Minimum liquidity provided (must exceed rewardableSupply)

returns.finalReward: The amount of governance tokens awarded to the caller

decimals().details: Decimals are computed by adding the decimal offset on top of the underlying asset's decimals. This "original" value is cached during construction of the vault contract. If this read operation fails (e.g., the asset has not been created yet), a default of 18 is used to represent the underlying asset's decimals. See {IERC20Metadata-decimals}.

deposit(uint256,address).custom:access-control: Available to any caller when not paused
deposit(uint256,address).custom:mev-protection: Prevents same-block operations for the receiver
deposit(uint256,address).custom:requirements: - amount must be greater than zero   - receiver must be a valid address (non-zero)   - Contract must not be paused   - Caller must have approved this contract to spend the tokens   - No operations in the same block for MEV protection
deposit(uint256,address).custom:state-changes: - Updates liquidityOperationBlock[receiver] to current block   - Increases totalBase and totalSuppliedLiquidity by amount   - Mints vault shares to receiver according to ERC4626 calculation
deposit(uint256,address).details: Implements ERC4626 deposit functionality with additional features:      - MEV protection via same-block operation prevention      - Protocol state tracking for liquidity management      - Integration with reward eligibility tracking

params.amount: Amount of base asset to deposit
params.receiver: Address that will receive the minted vault shares

returns._0: shares Number of vault shares minted to the receiver

flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).custom:access-control: Available to any caller when not paused
flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).custom:error-cases: - ZeroAmount: When amount is zero   - ZeroAddress: When receiver is zero address   - LowLiquidity: When insufficient funds available   - FlashLoanFailed: When receiver callback returns false   - RepaymentFailed: When insufficient funds returned
flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).custom:fee: Flash loan fee is calculated as (amount * flashLoanFee) / 10000
flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).custom:requirements: - amount must be greater than zero   - receiver must be a valid contract address implementing IFlashLoanReceiver   - Sufficient liquidity must be available in the vault   - Contract must not be paused
flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).custom:state-changes: - Temporarily reduces vault balance during execution   - Increases totalBase by the flash loan fee   - No permanent state changes if properly repaid
flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).details: Implements the flash loan pattern where:      1. Assets are transferred to the receiver      2. Receiver executes arbitrary logic via callback      3. Assets plus fee must be returned in the same transaction      The flash loan enables capital-efficient arbitrage, liquidations,      and other advanced DeFi strategies without requiring upfront capital.

params.amount: Amount of base asset to flash loan
params.params: Arbitrary data passed to the receiver's callback function
params.receiver: Address of the contract that will receive the flash loan

getBorrowRate(uint8).details: Based on utilization, base rate, supply rate, and tier-specific jump rate

params.tier: The collateral tier to calculate the borrow rate for

returns._0: The current annual borrow interest rate in baseDecimals format

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getSupplyRate().details: Uses ERC4626's previewRedeem to calculate the current value of shares.      This automatically accounts for commission through virtual fee shares.

returns._0: The current annual supply interest rate in parts per million (1e6 = 100%)

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:emits: Initialized event with the initializer's address
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When any required address parameter is zero
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:requirements: - All address parameters must be non-zero   - baseAsset must be a valid ERC20 token with decimals() function   - Function can only be called once during deployment
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:state-changes: - Initializes all OpenZeppelin upgradeable contracts   - Sets baseDecimals based on the base asset's decimals   - Configures Chainlink Automation with 12-hour intervals   - Deploys and initializes a new LendefiPoRFeed contract   - Grants necessary roles to timelock and core contracts   - Caches initial protocol configuration
initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Performs comprehensive setup including:      - ERC4626 vault initialization with base asset      - Access control role assignments      - Chainlink Automation configuration      - Proof of Reserves feed deployment and setup      - Protocol configuration caching      This function can only be called once during proxy deployment.

params._assetsModule: Address of the assets module contract for asset management
params._ecosystem: Address of the ecosystem contract for reward distribution
params._timelock: Address of the timelock contract with admin privileges
params.baseAsset: Address of the ERC20 token used as the base asset
params.core: Address of the LendefiCore contract for this market
params.name: Name for the ERC20 vault token (e.g., "Lendefi USDC Vault")
params.symbol: Symbol for the ERC20 vault token (e.g., "lendUSDC")

isRewardable(address).custom:eligibility-criteria: - Time criterion: block.number - lastOperationBlock >= rewardInterval   - Amount criterion: user's base asset equivalent >= rewardableSupply   - System criterion: rewardAmount > 0 (rewards must be enabled)
isRewardable(address).custom:requirements: - Uses cached protocol config to avoid external calls   - Calculates user's effective liquidity based on their share balance
isRewardable(address).details: Evaluates reward eligibility based on multiple criteria:      - User must have performed at least one liquidity operation      - Sufficient time must have elapsed since last operation (>= rewardInterval)      - User must have supplied minimum required liquidity (>= rewardableSupply)      - Rewards must be enabled in the protocol configuration

params.user: Address of the user to check for reward eligibility

returns._0: bool True if the user is eligible to claim rewards, false otherwise

mint(uint256,address).custom:access-control: Available to any caller when not paused
mint(uint256,address).custom:mev-protection: Prevents same-block operations for the receiver
mint(uint256,address).custom:requirements: - shares must be greater than zero   - receiver must be a valid address (non-zero)   - Contract must not be paused   - Caller must have sufficient approved tokens for the calculated amount   - No operations in the same block for MEV protection
mint(uint256,address).custom:state-changes: - Updates liquidityOperationBlock[receiver] to current block   - Increases totalBase and totalSuppliedLiquidity by calculated amount   - Mints specified shares to receiver
mint(uint256,address).details: Implements ERC4626 mint functionality with additional protocol features.      Calculates the required asset amount to mint the specified shares.

params.receiver: Address that will receive the minted vault shares
params.shares: Number of vault shares to mint

returns._0: amount Amount of base asset required to mint the shares

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

pause().custom:state-changes: Sets the contract to paused state
pause().details: Prevents all user-facing functions from executing while allowing      admin functions to continue. Used for emergency response or maintenance.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

performUpkeep(bytes).custom:interval: Updates occur based on the interval state variable (default 12 hours)
performUpkeep(bytes).custom:requirements: - Sufficient time must have passed since last update (checked by interval)   - Function is typically called by Chainlink Automation nodes
performUpkeep(bytes).custom:state-changes: - Updates lastTimeStamp to current block timestamp   - Increments counter for tracking automation calls   - Updates the PoR feed with current TVL data
performUpkeep(bytes).details: This function is called by Chainlink Automation nodes at regular intervals to:      1. Update the timestamp tracking for interval management      2. Increment the counter for monitoring automation performance      3. Check the protocol's collateralization status      4. Update the PoR feed with current Total Value Locked (TVL)      5. Emit alerts if the protocol becomes undercollateralized      The automation ensures continuous transparency and monitoring of protocol health      without requiring manual intervention.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

redeem(uint256,address,address).custom:access-control: Available to any caller when not paused
redeem(uint256,address,address).custom:mev-protection: Prevents same-block operations for the owner
redeem(uint256,address,address).custom:requirements: - shares must be greater than zero   - receiver and owner must be valid addresses (non-zero)   - Contract must not be paused   - Owner must have sufficient shares for redemption   - If caller is not owner, must have sufficient allowance   - No operations in the same block for MEV protection
redeem(uint256,address,address).custom:state-changes: - Updates liquidityOperationBlock[owner] to current block   - Decreases totalBase and totalSuppliedLiquidity by calculated amount   - Burns specified shares from owner's balance
redeem(uint256,address,address).details: Implements ERC4626 redeem functionality with protocol-specific features.      Burns the specified shares and transfers corresponding assets to receiver.

params.owner: Address that owns the shares being redeemed
params.receiver: Address that will receive the redeemed assets
params.shares: Number of vault shares to redeem

returns._0: amount Amount of base asset transferred to receiver

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

repay(uint256,address).custom:accounting: Separates principal repayment from interest payments
repay(uint256,address).custom:requirements: - Caller must have PROTOCOL_ROLE (typically LendefiCore)   - Contract must not be paused   - Caller must have approved this contract to transfer the repayment amount
repay(uint256,address).custom:state-changes: - Decreases totalBorrow by the principal portion repaid   - Decreases borrowerDebt[sender] by the principal portion   - Increases totalBase by the full repayment amount   - Increases totalAccruedInterest by any interest portion
repay(uint256,address).details: This function is exclusively used by the LendefiCore contract to      handle loan repayments. It properly accounts for principal and interest      portions of the repayment and updates vault state accordingly.

params.sender: Address of the borrower making the repayment

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setProtocolConfig((uint256,uint256,uint2.custom:emits: - ProtocolConfigUpdated: Always emitted with the new configuration
setProtocolConfig((uint256,uint256,uint2.custom:requirements: - Caller must have PROTOCOL_ROLE (typically the LendefiCore contract)
setProtocolConfig((uint256,uint256,uint2.custom:state-changes: - Updates the protocolConfig state variable with new configuration
setProtocolConfig((uint256,uint256,uint2.details: Synchronizes the vault's cached config with updates from the core contract.      This function is called by the core contract when protocol parameters change      to ensure the vault operates with current settings.

params._config: The new protocol configuration containing updated parameters

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalAssets().details: Overrides ERC4626 totalAssets to return the vault tracked total.      This includes supplied liquidity, accrued interest, and fees.

returns._0: The total amount of base assets in the vault

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

unpause().custom:state-changes: Removes the paused state from the contract
unpause().details: Re-enables all user-facing functions that were disabled during pause.      Should only be called after resolving the issue that caused the pause.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

utilization().custom:edge-cases: Returns 0 when no liquidity supplied or no borrowing activity
utilization().custom:gas-optimization: Caches storage reads to minimize SLOAD operations
utilization().details: Utilization rate indicates how much of the supplied liquidity is currently      borrowed. It's calculated as (totalBorrow / totalSuppliedLiquidity) and      expressed in baseDecimals format (e.g., 0.5e6 = 50% utilization).

returns.u: The protocol's current utilization rate scaled by baseDecimals

withdraw(uint256,address,address).custom:access-control: Available to any caller when not paused
withdraw(uint256,address,address).custom:mev-protection: Prevents same-block operations for the owner
withdraw(uint256,address,address).custom:requirements: - amount must be greater than zero   - receiver and owner must be valid addresses (non-zero)   - Contract must not be paused   - Owner must have sufficient shares for the withdrawal   - If caller is not owner, must have sufficient allowance   - No operations in the same block for MEV protection
withdraw(uint256,address,address).custom:state-changes: - Updates liquidityOperationBlock[owner] to current block   - Decreases totalBase and totalSuppliedLiquidity by amount   - Burns calculated shares from owner's balance
withdraw(uint256,address,address).details: Implements ERC4626 withdraw functionality with protocol-specific features.      Burns the necessary shares to withdraw the specified asset amount.

params.amount: Amount of base asset to withdraw
params.owner: Address that owns the shares being burned
params.receiver: Address that will receive the withdrawn assets

returns._0: shares Number of shares burned to complete the withdrawal

assetsModule().notice: Address of the assets module contract for asset management

baseDecimals().notice: Decimal multiplier for the base asset (10^decimals)

boostYield(address,uint256).notice: Boosts vault yield by adding liquidation proceeds or other revenue

borrow(uint256,address).notice: Allows the protocol to borrow assets from the vault's liquidity

borrowerDebt(address).notice: Mapping of borrower addresses to their outstanding debt amounts

checkUpkeep(bytes).notice: Determines if automated upkeep should be performed by Chainlink nodes

claimReward().notice: Claims accumulated governance token rewards for eligible liquidity providers

constructor.notice: Disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization

counter().notice: Counter tracking the number of automated upkeep operations performed

deposit(uint256,address).notice: Deposits base assets into the vault and mints shares to the receiver

ecosystem().notice: Address of the ecosystem contract managing governance rewards

flashLoan(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Executes a flash loan by temporarily lending assets without collateral

getBorrowRate(uint8).notice: Calculates the current borrow interest rate for a specific collateral tier

getSupplyRate().notice: Calculates the current supply interest rate for liquidity providers

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initializes the vault with essential parameters and sets up integrations

interval().notice: Time interval between automated Proof of Reserves updates

isRewardable(address).notice: Determines if a user is eligible to claim governance token rewards

lastTimeStamp().notice: Timestamp of the last automated upkeep execution

lendefiCore().notice: Address of the LendefiCore contract managing this market

mint(uint256,address).notice: Mints a specific number of vault shares to the receiver

pause().notice: Pauses all vault operations in case of emergency

performUpkeep(bytes).notice: Performs automated Proof of Reserve updates via Chainlink Automation

porFeed().notice: Address of the Proof of Reserves feed for this market

protocolConfig().notice: Cached protocol configuration to avoid repeated external calls

redeem(uint256,address,address).notice: Redeems vault shares for base assets

repay(uint256,address).notice: Processes debt repayment from protocol borrowers

setProtocolConfig((uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: Updates the cached protocol configuration with new parameters

timelock().notice: Address of the timelock contract with protocol governance

totalAccruedInterest().notice: Total interest accrued from borrowers and flash loan fees

totalAssets().notice: Returns the total amount of base assets managed by the vault

totalBase().notice: Total base asset currently held in the vault

totalBorrow().notice: Total amount currently borrowed by protocol users

totalSuppliedLiquidity().notice: Total amount of base asset supplied by liquidity providers

unpause().notice: Resumes normal vault operations after being paused

utilization().notice: Calculates the current utilization rate of the vault's liquidity

version().notice: Contract version number for upgrade tracking

withdraw(uint256,address,address).notice: Withdraws a specific amount of base assets from the vault

documentation.text:
@notice Decimal multiplier for the base asset (10^decimals)
 @dev Used for precise calculations and rate computations across the protocol

@notice Total amount of base asset supplied by liquidity providers
 @dev Tracks the cumulative deposits from all LPs, used for utilization calculations

@notice Total interest accrued from borrowers and flash loan fees
 @dev Represents protocol revenue that increases vault share value over time

@notice Total base asset currently held in the vault
 @dev Includes supplied liquidity, accrued interest, and flash loan fees

@notice Total amount currently borrowed by protocol users
 @dev Tracks outstanding debt that reduces available liquidity for withdrawals

@notice Counter tracking the number of automated upkeep operations performed
 @dev Used for monitoring and debugging Chainlink Automation integration

@notice Time interval between automated Proof of Reserves updates
 @dev Default is 12 hours, determines frequency of PoR feed updates

@notice Timestamp of the last automated upkeep execution
 @dev Used by Chainlink Automation to determine when next update is needed

@notice Contract version number for upgrade tracking
 @dev Incremented with each contract upgrade via UUPS pattern

@notice Address of the Proof of Reserves feed for this market
 @dev Provides real-time reserve data for transparency and monitoring

@notice Address of the LendefiCore contract managing this market
 @dev Core contract handles collateral management and lending logic

@notice Address of the ecosystem contract managing governance rewards
 @dev Handles distribution of governance tokens to liquidity providers

@notice Address of the assets module contract for asset management
 @dev Used for accessing asset tier information and jump rates

@notice Address of the timelock contract with protocol governance
 @dev Receives protocol fees when they are collected

@notice Cached protocol configuration to avoid repeated external calls
 @dev Contains interest rates, fees, and reward parameters

@notice Mapping of borrower addresses to their outstanding debt amounts
 @dev Tracks individual borrower positions for repayment calculations

@notice Storage gap for future upgrades
 @dev Reserves storage slots for upgradeable contract pattern

@notice Emitted when the vault is successfully initialized
 @param admin Address that performed the initialization

@notice Emitted when the protocol configuration is updated
 @param config The new protocol configuration
@notice Thrown when a required address parameter is the zero address
@notice Thrown when attempting operations in the same block (MEV protection)
@notice Thrown when an operation is attempted with zero amount
@notice Thrown when insufficient liquidity is available for the requested operation
@notice Thrown when a flash loan execution fails
@notice Thrown when flash loan repayment is insufficient
@notice Thrown when an invalid fee parameter is provided

@notice Validates that an amount parameter is greater than zero
 @param amount The amount to validate

@notice Validates that an address parameter is not the zero address
 @param addr The address to validate

@notice Disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization
 @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () view external returns (struct IPROTOCOL.ProtocolConfig memory)
function () view external returns (struct IPROTOCOL.ProtocolConfig memory)

documentation.text:
@dev Calculates the virtual fee shares that would be minted if fees were collected now.
 This represents the protocol's earned but uncollected commission.

@dev Internal conversion function (from assets to shares) with support for rounding direction.
 Modified to account for protocol commission by adjusting the total supply calculation.

@dev Internal conversion function (from shares to assets) with support for rounding direction.
 Modified to account for protocol commission by adjusting the total supply calculation.
@custom:oz-upgrades
